IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Miracle League of Arizona is a non-profit organization in North Scottsdale, dedicated to providing a safe, successful, and enjoyable baseball experience for children, teens, and adults with disabilities or special health care needs. We offer adaptive baseball, at an accessible stadium, removing the barriers that would normally keep these individuals off the baseball field.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Miracle League of Arizona is a non-profit organization in North Scottsdale, dedicated to providing a safe, successful, and enjoyable baseball experience for children, teens, and adults with disabilities or special health care needs. We offer adaptive baseball, at an accessible stadium, removing the barriers that would normally keep these individuals off the baseball field.
IRS990.Desc: Maintain and operate a specialized baseball field for children, teens, and adults with disabilities or special health care needs. In 2022-2023, 280 individuals were able to take part in this program.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Familial relationship on the Board of Directors

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee will have and may exercise the powers of the Board of Directors in the management of the business and affairs of the corporation while the Board is not in session, subject to limitations as set by the Board. The Executive Committee shall not have the authority of the full Board of Directors in reference to the following matters: the filling of vacancies on the Board of Directors or on any committee of the Board of Directors; appointment or removal of officers; the amendment or repeal of the bylaws, or adoption of new bylaws; and any extraordinary or fundamental change in the structure or activities of the corporation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors shall elect members with an affirmative vote of 2/3 of the Directors required for election. Each member shall be entitled to one vote on each matter submitted to a vote of the members. Members can be suspended or expelled by a 2/3 affirmative vote of the Board of Directors after an appropriate hearing and may, after 15 days written notice and by a majority vote of those present at any regular constituted meeting, have their membership terminated. Members may also resign their membership by filing a written resignation with the Secretary. Membership is not transferable or assignable.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Members duly elected to the Board of Directors have the authority to elect Officers of the Board and to participate in appointing an Executive Committee as well as other committees as determined to be necessary.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee will have and may exercise the powers of the Board of Directors in the management of the business and affairs of the corporation while the Board is not in session, subject to limitations as set by the Board. The Executive Committee shall not have the authority of the full Board of Directors in reference to the following matters: the filling of vacancies on the Board of Directors or on any committee of the Board of Directors; appointment or removal of officers; the amendment or repeal of the bylaws, or adoption of new bylaws; and any extraordinary or fundamental change in the structure or activities of the corporation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Treasurer presents the Form 990 to the President of the Board, who in turn presents the Form 990 to the full Board of Directors at the next meeting of the Board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compliance is verified at Board meetings.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Director's salary and benefits are reviewed annually by the Executive Committee and presented to the full Board of Directors for approval by majority vote.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation of all other employees will be determined by the Executive Director with final approval coming from the Executive Committee.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
The Organization made no changes to its oversight or selection process during the fiscal year covered by the return.
